page.title: 10ROAD ACCIDENTS IN BURWELL.
page.content: In the parish of Burwell 7 out of 10 accidents happened when people turned right,left or missed junctions.Another 2 were caused by bad road conditions such as ice,snow,rain and fog. A common{cause of serious accidents is when drivers go too fast and without wearing seat-belts.An example took place on a Tuesday along Heath Road.A car was travelling at 60m.p.h. when the driver lost control on the brow of a hill.He hit another vehicle coming the other way. Most accidents involved cars rather than lorries,motor-bikes or bicycles. At school every year there is a {Cycling Proficiency Test}to see if children are safe on their bikes. This year a big{County Safe Cycling {Competion}was held in Burwell.2 Village College pupils won prizes of a radio and a watch.
